meta.dataNotice: No tenant-identifiable data used; all sources are aggregated and publication-approved.

executiveSummary.title: Executive Summary
executiveSummary.summary: ETE Benchmark 2026-Q1 synthesizes benchmarked scarcity, hiring velocity, and risk signals without tenant-identifiable data.
highlights: Data roles show rising scarcity in national benchmarks (2026-Q1) (latest: 3.2 index)
Median time-to-fill is lengthening for target roles (2026-Q1) (latest: 47.0 days)
Market heatmap highlights emerging hubs (2026-Q1) (latest: 61.0 index)
Applied AI segments: median 52 days (tightening, high confidence).
Technical program management: median 44 days (stable, medium confidence).
Report is reproducible each quarter using published benchmark releases and aggregated intelligence.
footnotes: All figures shown are pre-aggregated and publication-approved.

marketOverview.title: Market Overview
marketOverview.summary: Market signals anchored to 2026-Q1 benchmarks across scarcity, velocity, and regional dynamics.
highlights: market-heatmap: Regional concentration and growth indicators derived from benchmark signals.
scarcity-index: Demand signals for technical roles using benchmark scarcity index.
time-to-fill: Operational speed benchmarked across opted-in tenants.
footnotes: Snapshot interpretations rely on benchmark aggregates only.

scarcityAndVelocity.title: Scarcity & Velocity Trends
scarcityAndVelocity.summary: Aggregated benchmark movements for talent scarcity and hiring velocity with quarterly comparisons.
footnotes: Trends exclude tenant-level identifiers and rely on suppression thresholds.

riskSignals.title: Risk Signals
riskSignals.summary: Forward-looking risk views based on aggregated forecasts and confidence-weighted velocity changes.
highlights: Technical program management 60d: 44 days (stable; medium confidence).
footnotes: Forecasts are aggregated; no tenant or candidate data is surfaced.

leadershipActions.title: What This Means for Leaders
leadershipActions.summary: Recommended focus areas derived from benchmarks, snapshots, and forward-looking signals.
highlights: Prioritize roles flagged in scarcity index: Data roles show rising scarcity in national benchmarks (2026-Q1).
Mitigate hiring delays in tightening segments (Applied AI).
Align quarterly workforce plans to benchmarked velocity and apply suppression rules for all exports.
